meanings.definition: Instigate or stir up (an undesirable or violent sentiment or course of action)
meanings.sent1: The troublemaker tried to foment a fight among the students.
meanings.sent2: The politician's speech was meant to foment unrest in the community.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to foment chaos in the peaceful park.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to foment a storm of emotions within him.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds seemed to foment a sense of impending doom.
